Reviews.Title: “Genio Hotel -- Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: frettingmom
Reviews.Content: Genio Hotel is an older facility that could certainly use a facelift. It is fairly clean but dated. HOWEVER, its location is superb! You are just steps from the famous Piazza Navona where you can enjoy all the outdoor cafes and activities of the season. The taxi stand is literally outside the front door of the hotel. You can walk down the street and catch the hop on, hop off bus for approx 19 euro for an all-day pass, which will take you to all the famous sites. (I highly suggest the RED bus only. Expect to be husselled to take green or blue bus, but DO NOT fall for this one). Also, Genio Hotel has a charming rooftop cafe where you can enjoy your free breakfast and view the sites of the city. The downside to this hotel is that the concierges are not extremely helpful. They don't have much information on buses, trains, fares, or activities other than to perhaps recommend their friends. We had asked the concierge for a restaurant with a good atmosphere, music and good wine and he suggested somewhere he used to work. We just accidentally stumbled upon Piazza Navona as we were trying to find that restaurant . The Piazza met all those requirements!! I would still recommend this hotel as it is so centrally located and reasonably priced that I believe it's a good value! Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Very average - definitely shouldn't be a 4 Star; more like a 3.”
Reviews.Author: Tribblator
Reviews.Content: We arrived late because the shared transport didn't pick us up. We found the room bare and not inviting. We went downstairs to reception and asked a the receptionist where we could go for dinner nearby. He looked at us with a blank face and said, "Nowhere." We thought he hadn't understood so we got out our map and asked again. He pointed to the area around the hotel and said, "Nowhere to eat." We went out to look and found lots of lovely restaurants in the next street. The other staff were helpful after though. The beds were very uncomfortable and the street was very noisy. Breakfast was average, the coffee was always stewed. Overall very disappointing and should not be 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Lisa686
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in a three bed room. (double bed + a small bed that we didn't use) It wasn't very modern or fancy but our basic needs were met. It was clean, safe and nice and had a very nice breakfast and roof top (with antipasti, mozarella, and regular bread, cheese and yoghurt among other things. No eggs & bacon if you are looking for that) The staff was friendly and the room and bathroom was cleaned every day. We had some electricity troubles and the noice from outside was sometimes loud. No problems when the window were closed though. You could hear people talking when passing by their rooms but we did not hear from other rooms while we were in our room. The elevator was very small, we had some trouble getting the baby stroller in and out so if you are in need of a big elevator maybe this is not the place for you. You also need to be able to walk a few steps in the stairs to get to the breakfast room. The location is excellent. Walking distance to many sights and the busy nightlife with restaurants is just a block away so it was easy to pop in and out of the room between sightseeing and dinner. The neighbourhood always felt safe. We enjoyed the stay and can definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Three Generations (a 25, 44 and 73 year old went to Rome).”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is positioned in the heart of Rome where you are able to access all the sites by foot. The Vatican is a 10 minute walk over the river, the Colosseum is a 25 minute walk (but there are many sites of interest on the way), the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain are both 10 minutes away. The Hotel also has a fantastic roof terrace for use throughout your stay no matter what time of day or night. The terrace has views to the Vatican, Spanish Steps and many other stunning sites. The hotel itself is opulent and elegantly decorated in a classic Italian style, rooms are large and decorated to a high standard. Reception staff speak perfect English and are always happy to help, providing you with a map upon arrival and directions to the various sites. Breakfast is substantial and takes place on the 6th floor that shares the views of the roof terrace. Although there is some noise from the street it did not effect our sleep or trip at all and noise should be expected in a city. There is a lovely Piazza 2 minutes walk from the hotel which has a fantastic atmosphere. I would strongly recommend Hotel Genio to anyone wanting to maximise their time in Rome and would stay here again when we return. A fantastic hotel and city which needs to be seen to be believed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, central-ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Kevin D
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located within the centre of Rome. All important monuments within walking distance. We stayed 4 nights at Genio and offcourse didn't see our room much cause we were out a lot. The rooms may not be the most modern but they have got all you need for a stay in Rome. Nice rooftop breakfast-room, when the temperature is ok you can have a breakfast 'All fresco'. Friendly and very helpfull staff. Small fitness-room to trim off the carbs you'll be having from eating all that pasta 'Cacio 'e pepe'.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Wendy C
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week bedding and towels were changed daily staff were very helpful at reception breakfast was what we were expecting and plentiful hotel and room was very clean and in a great location

Reviews.Title: “I'll pick somewhere else next time...”
Reviews.Author: nikki_purcell84
Reviews.Content: Great location in being close to pantheon and Vatican, great roof top terrace over looking Rome but rooms in desperate need of an update. A step back into the 80s, shower built so water goes straight onto bathroom floor, hot water intermittent, can hear peoples conversations in rooms beside, elevator extremely slow stairs quicker, double bed is 2 singles pushed together. Breakfast has a cold meat, pastry and cereal variety, and staff are barely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor value, not 4*”
Reviews.Author: jerseyman1
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the weekend Italy played England in the Six Nations. Room basic, bathroom mouldy, hot water intermittent. staff mixed between helpful and disinterested. Breakfast on top floor OK in Continental sense. Well situated adjacent to Piazza Navonna and all major sights in walking distance. Would find another hotel on next trip

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Kezza48
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a perfect position near the Tiber river, so you can walk to The Vatican, Prati and Trastavere neighbourhoods and also all the historic areas of central Rome. There is a bus route at the door to Termini Rail Station and Colosseum if you do not like to walk this far. The roof top terrace with seats and tables, is a bonus, with its amazing views over Rome; as is the Breakfast room with the same views. The Continental breakfast buffet provides a large choice and plenty of food. Staff are helpful and friendly. Our room had a safe, very useful, and the bed was comfortable and bathoom clean. Unfortunately the room heaters could not be adjusted, they were either off or on. We were there at Christmas and it was quite stifling in the room. Also we had a front room over the street, which was noisy at night. Apparently Europe does not provide tea/coffee making facilities in any hotel, B&B and this was no exception. However we stayed 5 nights and did enjoy our time there.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: The-Brummie091
Reviews.Content: The Genio is in a great position near Piazza Navona, The noise from outside and from within the hotel is extreme, we could hear the next room using the bathroom and shower, (we were in 303), you could hear conversations from other rooms as you walked past. The roof terrace has some great views towards the Vatican and the city and is worth the extra few steps, keep going around the roof to a spiral staircase and go up them, the view is great. The shower was hard to get right too hot or too cold, black mould in the bathroom. The maid just walked into the room without knocking. There is free WIFI but was very slow. Breakfast was OK. There is a free left luggage area (not very secure as you are left in there by your self with other luggage there), there is a very handy safe in the room (not big enough for a lap top but great for passports money camera etc). Front house staff were helpful. Taxi rank outside 10 euro to Terimini Station 30 euro to Ciampino Airport. No A/C working room was very warm (in January) buses to most places suggest you download a bus app.There are loads of restaurants in the area some great value and some high class ones. I paid 85.00 euro per night double room (2 single beds pushed together) good value for Rome. The bar behind reception is not a talking point, but there is a well equipped mini bar, a supermarket around the corner has water for 18 cent and a liter of wine 2 euro, I took their stuff out and put ours in the fridge. Summary 4* no, 2* at best.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our three night break”
Reviews.Author: mowplus
Reviews.Content: WE stayed here for three nights, it's in a great location, the staff are friendly, the breakfast is great and the rooms are comfortable! Within walking distance to ALL the sights. We found an amazing tratorria in La travestere called la Frashetta, amazing food at very reasonable prices, don't leave it too late or you'll have to que.

Reviews.Title: “Great Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Camelgirl43
Reviews.Content: Last month (Nov. 2011) we spent 5 days at this centrally located Rome Hotel. We booked online so we really didn't know what it would be like since photos are often misleading. This time they weren't! And we didn't realize the good price included a large delicious buffet breakfast. There are back rooms that are dark but they let us look at several and we picked a top floor which was sunny & bright. The same rooms lower down were dark because they faced other buildings. We looked over tile rooftops. The front rooms would all be bright but they were on the street, which might have been noisy. Oh, and free wi-fi if you have your own computer. Lobby computer charges. We will definitely go here again if we go to Rome. This hotel is only a 2 min. walk to Piazza Navona--it doesn't get better than that!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience again”
Reviews.Author: byrdrish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Genio several years ago, and liked it very much at that time. Now, it is better than ever and everything appeared to have been redecorated. The staff were exceptionally helpful, with advise on transportation to the hotel from Tibertina train station, and even helped us print out our boarding passes for our trip home. Our room was attractively furnished and a nice size, and the breakfast, served in a rooftop room with a charming view, was excellent. The location is, of course, perfect, right at Piazza Navona, and we walked to St. Peter's, Piazza del Popolo, .the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and Pantheon. There are countless restaurants in the immediate vicinity. We watched the sunset every afternoon from the pretty rooftop terrace. This was our fifth trip to Rome, and when we return we will certainly stay again at the Genio.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great View”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeB3
Reviews.Content: Just a block from Piazza Navona and an easy walk from the Vatican, The Coliseum and Trevi Fountain this is a perfect spot to explore Rome by foot. Terrific shopping and dining in all the alleys around the square as well. The staff was very helpful and the great breakfast with an incredible roof top view is hard to beat. For these reasons I would definitely stay there again. However the rooms are small, the shower is tiny and the water tempature constantly changes. The elevator is tiny and slow as well but if you are in shape the stairs are you're best option even to the 5th floor. They do have wifi in the rooms which were clean and comfortable. The good definitely outweighs the inconveniences but if you have limited mobility this is not your place.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: fabiweiss
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect, but is not the only thing. The room was really big to 3 persons, very clean and confortable. No noise at night, very good breakfest, and all the staff was very helpfull and polite. We didn't spend much time at the hotel because Rome is an amazing city and offers a lot of things to do and to see all day long,but at night it was good to enjoy the view at the terrace. To go to places far from the hotel there is a bus stop in front, and there are good restaurants too. I hope I can come back to Rome and I certainly will stay at Genio again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel to explore rome walking”
Reviews.Author: ervepe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good situated to visit Ancient Rome. Rooms are comfortable, big bathroom, excellent airco, Rooms are cleaned properly daily and the breakfast is very good and the breakfast terrace gives you an exciting view over Rome. If we go back to Rome we will certainly go back to Hotel Genio

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Notska
Reviews.Content: Hotel Genio is just "behind" Piazza Navona, its really easy to get there. The hotel is nice and clean - and guys in the reception were really helpful and polite and fun. I've visited Rome several times and usually dont stay at the same hotel as earlier - but now I think this might be the one whenever visiting Rome. There's also a lovely roof terrace with nice view all over the city. Nice place to enjoy the scenery with a glass of wine after long day walking around Rome. I had a single room which was quite ok, no view and tv was high on the cupboard, but it was roomy and clean. If you come from Aeroporto Fiumincino, take a train to Trastevere (8 eur) and then take the only one tram in Rome, nr 8 to its other end Teatro Argentina. Cross Corso Vittorio Emanuele II, walk through Piazza Navona and turn to left. I told abut this hotel to my working partner and he also said that he has visited Hotel Genio earlier and will stay there next time, too. A good choice!

Reviews.Title: “fabulously situation - hotel a bit tired but adequate”
Reviews.Author: KimPreston
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at this hotel a couple of times whilst in Rome. It is very well situated - just around the corner from Piazza Navona. It is supposed to be a 4 star hotel - but is really a 3 star at best. The rooms are adequate though and the breakfast in the hotel is ok. There are plenty of places in eat and drink around and about the hotel. I would recommend staying at this hotel - but only if you are going to spend most of your time out and about and manage to book it at a discount on their normal prices.

Reviews.Title: “They Overbook”
Reviews.Author: RugglesTravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself deserves the four-star rating. The rooms are very comfortable, location is excellent, and the breakfast excellent. However, my prepaid reservation was at first not honored when the receptionist told me that they over-booked. They wanted to move me to another hotel and I basically said I was going to sleep in their lobby if they did not give me the reserved room. Finally they gave me the room, saying that they are going to have to move someone else. The receptionist told me that the guests get angry with him, and it is the reservation office that overbooks. Not a good thing!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooftop terrace”
Reviews.Author: willworldhop
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the location and the rooftop terrace. The size of the room was fine. Bathroom was great. Shower temp fluctuated greatly in the mornings , but we could put up with it. We loved the monring breakfast on the terrace and the evenings on the terrace were a great way to end the day. The front desk went out of their way to help us. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle092
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers, our family group of 8 made reservations for three rooms back in December 2010 for a June 2011 vacation. Although my FIL confirmed the reservation 3 times during those six months, it wasn't until we arrived at the hotel that we were told they had overbooked! With little recourse, we were moved to another hotel in the chain (Hotel Elisio), far away from our preferred location. If you're debating picking Hotel Genio based on its great location near the Vatican and Piazza Navona, don't risk it!

Reviews.Title: “Very annoyed!”
Reviews.Author: SRB_11
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night family trip to Rome and am very annoyed with the staff at the Hotel Genio. I booked 2 double rooms and 1 single room directly with this hotel back in October 2010 and received e-mail confirmation of my booking straight away. However, it was only when we were in the taxi (arranged by them) en-route to the Genio that they telephoned to inform me that a mistake had been made and that there were no rooms available for us! They said they had made arrangements for us to go to another hotel in the Leonardi Group (the Hotel Elisio). I am annoyed that this has happened and disgusted by the underhand way in which they delayed telling me so that their was no easy way of refusing their alternative. We particularly wanted to stay at the Genio (it was in the area of Rome that was most convenient for us and the hotel had also been recommended to us by a friend). So - be warned!! (I had to give an overall rating for this hotel to be able to submit this report but ,obviously, I have no knowledge of it's standard).

Reviews.Title: “nightmare”
Reviews.Author: jarnefelt
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location near Piazza Navona, so it seems, with a bus stop in front. Single rooms however, the most expensive p.p., are on the inside or rear of the building, with no view whatsoever, no daylight, no air, utterly claustrophobic. I refused the first extremely small one offered me. The replacement I got, with a bathroom bigger than the room itself and a ridiculous mirror of 2 by 1 meter, had no running water the second evening; I was asked if I could wait for that till tomorrow. After insisting I got an upgrade to a narrow "double" room, between two sheaths euphemistically called "chiostrina coperta" (with a noisy airco and kitchen odours) and "cortile a cielo libero" (with cigarette smoke from the personnel below). No way to open a window. Temperature was 27°C; the machine blew icy air into the room, and after half an hour it was still 25°. The very heavy, smooth bedspread kept slipping from the bed. For two persons the price would have been a formidable 300 €, tourist tax not included. Rooms must be emptied by 10 AM, which is closing time for breakfast. (But the second day my room was cleaned at 3 PM). That is served on the sixth floor, with a beautiful view from the terrace. The elevator broke down however on my first day. And they serve something that is extremely hard to find in Italy: execrable coffee. The staff was polite but icily indifferent; I suppose they are all aware that this hotel, mysteriously four-starred, is extremely lucrative but an utter shame. Relying on the newspapers and magazines in the lobby, the owners must be staunch Roman Catholics. They should go to confession.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but needs maintenance”
Reviews.Author: KirklandJoseph
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal location; however, it would benefit from a regular maintenance man. There were holes in the sheets, door plate was falling off, the view was of an alley. Having said that, the place was clean and the breakfast buffet was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay for THE awesome roof terrace!!”
Reviews.Author: carolheath
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 5 nights at the end of May for his 50th. The one negative thing we found about this hotel is the noise from the road if your bedroom is on the front, but if your window is closed it's fine! The plus points and the reason I would book here again is it is 2 minutes from the beautiful Piazza Navona and the roof terrace with the panoramic views of rome is something i will remember forever...having your breakfast( which is quite good) looking at the dome of st. Peter's...perfect!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking”
Reviews.Author: Vincent079
Reviews.Content: We booked a room well in advanced and over booked our stay. the only option they provided was a room outside of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, awesome weekend”
Reviews.Author: FiggeRox
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a wonderful area of Rome. The room was perfect, nice breakfast at the top of the hotel. Great view over Rome. Close to the river where you should cross over at Ponte Sisto and spend some time in Trastevere. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant location & rooftop garden - small rooms and hard beds”
Reviews.Author: robert0872715777
Reviews.Content: We used the roof top garden for BYO sundowners which is no problem for the hotel and makes drinking in Rome affordable, €7-€10 for beers on Pavona Piazzo so have water and pizza or basic pasta for an hour then watch the sun go down at your leisure with panoramic views. The hotel should have an explanation map of the views from this position? Beds hard and rooms small but the location and breakfast made you forget this negative aspect...

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ines_caki
Reviews.Content: Ok the hotel is not a normal 4 stars hotel, some rooms are a bit old, but when you go on holidays you don’t spend much time in the hotel… is in a Great location, is like 1 min away from piazza navona, 15min from Vatican city, near via del governo vecchio, where you can find loads of good restaurants. Comparing to some hotels I stayed in Italy, the breakfast is great, from the rooftop-terrasse you can see all Rome. The staff are nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great location, not so good matress!”
Reviews.Author: xfergyx
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location. The hotel is very close to the Pantheon and Piazza Navona. The service was so so because one day you would have a very nice helpful man at the front desk and the next you would have a grouch. you do have to pay to use the hotel computer/internet. The bathroom was vert elegant but the matress was very thin and hard. After 8 hours of walking and sightseeing I would have thought any bed would be a wecome sight, but I was proved wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: AliciaHill75
Reviews.Content: My mom was visiting me while I was living in Italy so I wanted to show her Rome before she returned home. I had just had my daughter about 3 wks. before traveling so I wanted to stay at a nicer hotel that would be comfortable for all of us. I was very pleased with the Hotel Genio. The hotel is beautiful, clean and in a prime location for many Roman tourist attractions. The staff were also very welcoming and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to travel to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “good location, but terrible room”
Reviews.Author: BelgianStefan
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location. However, I was given one of the worst rooms they had (avoid room 107). The windows

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, decent hotel, get what u pay for.. no complaints really”
Reviews.Author: amandanewjersey
Reviews.Content: great location, had a wonderful stay in Rome. Hard beds! besides that, it was a good spot

Reviews.Title: “My 3rd and last stay at Hotel Genio”
Reviews.Author: rlafleur99
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 3 times in the past 3 years. The first two times, I liked it very much. Good balance of location, price, quality. My last stay was end April 2010. We ended up getting a room which was the size of a closet with two "cots". I call them cots because they were smaller than the standard American twin bed. I was very disappointed about this, but chose not to complain. Overall, I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: zfan82
Reviews.Content: My first room was a cot in a closet. I didn't even have the space to put my suitcase flat to open it. I stayed there 2 nights and then they moved me to a small, but reasonable room. This hotel is in a great location as for walking to the Vatican, Castle St. Angelo, Trevi, Pantheon, etc. There is no parking available, and you pay 3 Euro for 1/2 an hour on their computer. My cousins complained that it was noisy at night in their rooms. The rooftop is not all rooftop. It is more of an open area that is a square around the top of the hotel. Beautiful views. The breakfast was limited and basic. It is just 1/2 a block away from Piazza Navona.

Reviews.Title: “Sanctuary from Volcano”
Reviews.Author: RobertPAdams
Reviews.Content: I was one on the many Britons stranded in Rome as a result of the volcanic dust cloud so my wife, daughter and I had to leave our rented apartment at the end of the booked period and, by chance, wandered into the Hotel Genio without knowledge or expectations of the hotel. This hotel provided one of the few pleasant experiences of our 'extended' stay. We had two rooms, a double and a single, both were reasonably sized, immaculately clean with excellent modern bathrooms complete with powerful showers. Our rooms were at the rear of the hotel, without a view, which meant they were very quiet indeed - something we appreciated. The roof terrace with unparalleled views over Rome proved to be a restful retreat from the stress of trying to find a way home. The hotel's comfortable lounge has two computers available to guests - these proved to be invaluable as did the TVs in the rooms which receive English speaking news programs. During our stay the sheets and towels were changed daily and the breakfast was more than adequate. All staff were polite and helpful at all times. The reception staff, Gianluca, Adelmo and Fabio, who all spoke excellent English as well as German and French, were very professional and helpful in sorting the many problems, they phoned embassies on behalf of guests, spoke to Italian travel agents regarding railway alternatives and regularly kept in contact with the airports/railway stations/ports to keep us all updated with the latest information. It must have been a hotel receptionist's nightmare with a full hotel and guests booking and unbooking their rooms according to the ever-changing, contradictory news reports. Yet, the staff were reassuring and did their best to accommodate all needs and requirements. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “stunning views from the rooftop terrace.”
Reviews.Author: johnThorp
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel genio for 4 nights. The location of this hotel is fantastic for visiting the pantheon, vatican,trevi fountain, coloseum. From the rooftop you can sit looking at st.peters basilica, especially at night lit up. the pantheon is over to the right. stunning views. Room was in the centre of the hotel overlooking the fire escapes, but I had just managed to get the last available room when booking. No problems with the hotel or staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Concertraveler
Reviews.Content: The Genio Hotel offers a number of pros and some cons. My girlfriend and I stayed for three nights at the beginning of our week long trip to Italy. We arrived on a Saturday morning around 10am with our bags in tow. At first glance it has a nice street presence in a neat, clean area of town just blocks from the Tiber River. We didn't expect our rooms to be ready and they weren't. However, the gentleman manning the front desk politely held our bags with him in a secure area until a room was ready around 1pm. We came back after exploring a couple of hours and checked in. Our room was good size with one full bed and a very large bathroom with tub. The room appeared clean but smelled like it was a smoking room. The view was not appealing overlooking the busy street in front of the hotel on the second floor. The street noise did prove to be a big negative at night because we wanted to sleep with the windows open to get some cool air. In all fairness, we didn't ask for another room because we figured it would be a hassle and were a little afraid we may be given a smaller room with other potential issues. Bathroom was nice and large, especially for a big city. The only complaint (and it is a big one) was that the water wasn't hot in the morning. It was great at night but not hot while we were getting ready between 8 and 9am. We just showered at night which was fine for a few days. Hotel staff were somewhat friendly. Not overly helpful and I did see them get into disagreements with some of the other guests for various reasons. The best part about the hotel is the location. It was perfectly located so we could walk to many of our destinations. It was also close to the "hop on hop off" buses we used the first two days. The Vatican is about a 10 minute walk and the Colosseum was about a 20 minute walk (we walked it once but to the bus the other times we were near it). Piazza Navone is few minutes away with a number of restaurants. Breakfast was included which was a huge plus. Great continental selection of fruit, pastries, cheese, yogurt, coffee, juice, etc. It was so helpful to get a good meal and hit the sights right away each day. Here is a breakdown of what we liked and disliked... PROS: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION Large Room Large Bathroom Great rooftop view Clean room Reasonably priced wi-fi connection Breakfast CONS: Room smelled like smoke Street noise at night Water didn't get hot in the morning No English speaking channels on the TV The hotel worked for what we were looking for--a moderately priced hotel with the basics and a convenient location. I would consider staying again in the future if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “romantic trips”
Reviews.Author: hemimara
Reviews.Content: Very nice distance "Walking distance" to alle the major attractions. Rooms OK, Bath hot water a problem in the morning and before dinner otherwise OK. Breakfast fine. Bed clothes and towels changed every day.

Reviews.Title: “Bad humour”
Reviews.Author: FORNARINABuenosAires
Reviews.Content: Very well located, but too expensive: 3 TV. Channels and pepople in the reception allways in a bad humour, that sucks!

Reviews.Title: “great location but”
Reviews.Author: kathy1955
Reviews.Content: close to alot of things hotel was clean has a rooftop terrace which was a plus but the front desk staff was not that friendly that would be my only gripe-not very accommodating

Reviews.Title: “Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: yyzdognut
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to everything. Fab rooftop! Bustop right outside. We spent every evening after dinner on the roof looking over the beautiful skyline of Old Rome. The rooms are adequate and the breakfast substantail. Great Value

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location; ; nice top floor deck”
Reviews.Author: Allen727286
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Genio for 6 nights. Ideal location for getting around by foot to the old city and the main sights. Room was decent size; bad bed, good bathroom. Great deck on top of their bldg (6th floor). Good views there and is relaxing if weather is moderate. We got the hotel reservation from an American Airlines vacation deal, so it was prepaid and there was no issue about getting our room (vs other reviews that have had problems).

Reviews.Title: “Good location near Piazza Navona.”
Reviews.Author: CapeCoral_FLDeb
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Hotel Genio. We had requested a room in the back of the hotel as advised on Trip Advisor. Breakfast was good, consisting of a wide variety of foods. The roof top garden was our favorite in the evenings after a long day of walking. Go next door, buy wine and snacks and enjoy the views!

Reviews.Title: “Had a greate time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: vacationisgoodforU
Reviews.Content: Had a greate time in Rome. The Hotel was good. Loctation was perfect. Service was good. 5 to 15 minutes walk to almost everything (exept the Collusseum) But there is a busstop 40 meters from the entrance. The bed was kinda small, but we managed. The room had aircondition 24/7. so it was great to come bak to a refrigerated room after an 8 hour walk in the Vatican. The Hotel also has a garden on the roof. Can recomend bringing a bottle of something up there when it cools down in the evning :) Overall it was a good hotell, and i think you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Advantages win easily. Tips on value eating.”
Reviews.Author: sandwichco
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Genio - we went back not for the super luxury (though the room was really very pleasant and nicely cleaned daily) but for the combination of location and roof terrace. These were the factors which had drawn us to this choice in the first place and they are truly outstanding. On the roof you can relax al fresco high above the street, read or snooze in sun or shade. The song Up On the Roof says it all. The furthest major sight is the Colosseum, a bit of a trek but all the other high spots are easily reachable on foot. For fantastic eating value at night we recommend you sail past the more expensive restaurants pitched at tourists and try Gino & Pietro's in Vicolo Savelli (if you can put up with the uneven cobbled street and proximity of scooters) - we usually had two courses wine and water for 28 - 34 Euro for two! The mixed bruschetta is wonderful, lovely spaghetti alla vongole, Saltimbocca alla Romana, tortellini cacio e pepe, pasta with ragu - everything is delicious and so reasonable. The house wines, white and red are very drinkable and so cheap. Similarly, for lunch why not be brave and go into the Snack Bar (the sign looks awful) on Banchi Nuovi where you'll find what ordinary Italians are having - very friendly, helpful service, panini made in front of you with wonderful breads and fresh fillings, lovely coffee and water for around 8 Euro for two! We went back several times.

Reviews.Title: “Am I in Heaven? Oh! It's the rooftop garden at”
Reviews.Author: Francobollo_9
Reviews.Content: Three brothers and 3 friends (all guys) went to Rome for 4 nights. I booked at the Genio Hotel from the "Leonardi Hotels" website, very easy. I selected the Genio for location and price. We checked in early afternoon, dropped the bags in our rooms and hit the roof garden before heading out. Wow! What a view. The Genio continued to impress and please. It's a great location yet still pretty quiet. The rooms were clean and well appointed. The staff was warm and friendly, not to mention helpful. A good breakfast buffet and espresso every morning. We would wear ourselves out during the day and go back to someones room or the roof garden (where we could smoke) with some wine and groceries to unwind - very comfortable. I would not hesitate to bring my wife here. If you require high luxury, the Genio may not fill the bill, though other hotels in the "Leonardi Hotels" group might. Overall very good experience. Would definitely go back to the Genio.

Reviews.Title: “Would not come back”
Reviews.Author: Alvarorrr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Genio hotel not by choice. The 4 star hotel I had booked did not have a room (by the way never go to hotel Atlante) and they found me a room at what they claimed was a 4 star hotel called Genio. The hotel is very well located next to Pl Navona and 5 min walk from Fontana di Trevi or Via del Corso. My room for which I paid 147EUR was small (I was on my own and found the room very small) with no natural light although admittedly quite clean. Breakfast was repulsive and far from the standard I would expect in Italy or in a 4 star hotel (but I know that in Italy you always need to remove at least one star to compare with hotels elsewhere). Staff at reception was particularly unpleasant and I had to make a great effort to obtain basic information or to have them to get the invoice right. Overall I never chose to go Hotel Genio now I know I would not go back again.

Reviews.Title: “What a location”
Reviews.Author: Deirdre065
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day stay in the Hotel Genio - I was slightly aprehensive having read other reviews however I think these reviewers must have been staying in a different hotel to the one we stayed in. The Hotel is in a fantastic location approx 1 min walk from Piazza Navona and within walking distance of all the sites in Rome. It has cafes, bars and great restaurants right outside the door. The rooms were excellent, extremely clean, crisp bed linen and wonderful bathrooms. The reception staff were friendly and efficient and the breakfast was continental style and very impressive with a large selection of pastrys, cheese, ham, fruit, etc. you could not leave the breakfast room hungry. The hotel is great value for money and we would high recommend staying here we will certainly do so again on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “POOR POOR POOR”
Reviews.Author: lynn_moore3
Reviews.Content: Hate to say it but there really does seem to be a trend with this hotel. We booked on-line for a romantic anniversary break and on arrival the guy on reception cleary wasn't expecting us. After some huffing and puffing we were given the key to room 503 and on entry saw that we had twin beds - not the double we'd confirmed directly with the hotel. Whilst the good woman went downstairs to sort it out I reviewed the room. Clean, nice balcony, big bathroom - result I thought! What was really nice were all the expensive toiletries in the bathroom. Then I noticed a toothbrush (used), slippers on the floor and a suitcase by the bed - now I was feeling a bit like Goldilocks! When I went downstairs the guy on reception was adamant that the room had been checked out and that the people must be returning soon to clear their stuff. He even suggested we leave our things in the room and return later!! Episode 2 - he gave us a key to another room (303) this time a double-bed but it hadn't been made, the bathroom was filthy and there was rubbish everywhere. Back downstairs only to be told by the receptionist that "Well I did only say it 'should' be ready" Anyway, we eventually got a room (2 singles pushed together with a double sheet over, one hard mattress, one soft, the breakfast was ok and the location great but none of it compensating for not 1, but 3 sour-faced receptionists who clearly wanted to be somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Charming great located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sunflowera
Reviews.Content: I stayed several times at the Genio, usually with friends on a fun trips. The location is great, the rooms are ok for the price, always clean. The breakfast room is a bit small, but the food is ok. What I love in this hotel is the staff, very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fire Scare - No Apologies - Don't Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: AbuElBanat
Reviews.Content: Good location, decent rooms, but I would never stay at a Leonardi (the owners of the Genio) property again. Here is an email we sent to the management. We went through a scary experience that disrupted our stay, and upset many hotel guests. They never apologized. They never had the decency to respond after numerous attempts to contact them. (I know they received our emails. When I sent another email with a different return address asking about a future reservation, they quickly responded). This is no way to treat a customer. Here is our story - as told to Leonardi in our complaint: Dear Sir: We have been staying at your Hotel Genio property since Sunday, July 15 in two rooms. Last night, as you may already know, the fire alarm sounded at approximately 12:45 AM (00:45). While this can happen anywhere, the response of the hotel staff was completely inadequate, creating confusion and distress among the hotel’s guests. The night manager on duty, having no idea what to do when the alarm went off, simply stood behind the desk and did nothing. He did not even know whether it was a real or a false alarm. Later we were told that he had checked the building, but I was one of the first people in the lobby immediately after the alarm sounded and I can tell you he did nothing. In fact, he refused to call either the police or the fire department. In the absence of assistance from the hotel, a few guests took it upon themselves to first alert all guests and get them out of the building. Then we began demanding that the manager call the police, and absent any action on his part, attempted to use cell phones and pay phones to reach the police, even going so far as to walk around the neighborhood in search of help. In the end, we, your guests, stood outside the hotel for over an hour before any additional hotel management arrived, and it was another 20 minutes before the police finally arrived. No explanations were offered; no attempt to make us comfortable was made. Eventually we were told that it was safe to return to the hotel, but since nobody had yet checked the building for any possible smoke or fire conditions, most of us were unwilling to take the manager’s word. It was 2:30 AM by the time the police and firefighters added their assurances and we went back to our rooms. I have characterized the hotel’s response as inadequate. Your manager on duty was clearly not prepared for an emergency. His refusal to contact any emergency personnel is beyond comprehension. Another hotel guest repeatedly asked to see a written copy of the emergency response procedure, but it could not be located. We were even more concerned for our safety because earlier in the evening we were told that the hotel’s outside phone lines were not working. We were fortunate that this was a false alarm. Had it been an actual fire, there is no doubt that the hotel’s response would have resulted in injuries and loss of life. We expect much better of a hotel in the Leonardi group. We considered checking out this morning, but decided to complete the 3-night stay we originally booked through venere.com. We will be checking out as planned tomorrow morning. I expect to see a full credit for last night (both rooms) on our bill at checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Sting!!”
Reviews.Author: Markysharky
Reviews.Content: Beware anyone considering booking this hotel!!!. Having booked through the hotel's own web site 2 months in advance we arrived only to find a very brusque front desk clerk telling us that they had overbooked and we should make our way to another hotel in the chain that had a room. When I asked to see the manager I was told he 'was not on duty until the evening'. Reluctantly we switched to the other hotel (Argentine) which turned out to be fine, with much more courteous staff. This however was not the point, we chose the Genio afor its location. We insisted the Genio paid for the taxi. If you read through the full set of reviews of the Genio you will find this scenario (scam) has happened a number of times. What made our experience even more frustrating was that the Genio had offered to arrange airport transfers, which we accepted. On arrival the driver was there to meet us and, after a smooth journey, dropped us in good faith at a hotel we had been bounced from yet the hotel did not have the decency to tell us nor the driver in advance. So if you choose to book the Genio you have no guarantee you will get to stay there...!!

Reviews.Title: “Struck Gold at the Genio”
Reviews.Author: Happytravelers010
Reviews.Content: We were booked at another hotel in this group - the 3* Daniela, which appeared OK but was in a slightly remote location away from Termini station. On our arrival there at 22.30 we were not best pleased to be told that the hotel was full - but they could transfer us to the 4* Genio at no extra charge. We struck gold in this respect because the Genio is in a fantastic location by the Piazza Navona (we think the nicest Piazza in Rome) - v. central within walking distance of just about everything. The room if slightly on the compact size was decorated and serviced to a high standard. The hotel has a lovely roof terrace with views of the Rome skyline. The front desk staff are efficient, charming and could not have been more helpful. They organised our return airport transfer to Fumincino airport in chauffeur driven Merc for 45 Euro - great deal to avoid mayhem of Termini station in rush hour. Only slght niggle - coffee served at breakfast wasn't too hot in any sense of the word. But -OVERALL A GREAT STAY & TERRIFIC. 3 DAY BREAK. Geoff & Marie, Edinburgh, Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Genio”
Reviews.Author: sicily_2007
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our stay at the Genio and was delighted with the hotel. Location is super, 3 mins walk to the piazza navona and easy walking to the trevi and the pantheon. The staff were great and couldn't do enough to help you find your way across the city. The rooms were tastefully decorated and well furnished. The Roof terrace was clean and tidy with plenty of seats and tables for your morning breakfast ( 3 euro for breakfast on the roof ). The Breakfast room was a good size, flooded with light and the food was very acceptable. I would definitely recommend the genio and would stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but...”
Reviews.Author: Carlisle54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Genio for 3 nights. We had initially booked another hotel, but switched to the Genio because of its location near the Piazza Navona. The location was ideal and we walked to all the sites and attractions. The hotel itself was a little tired looking and our room smelled quite musty. It may have been related to a flooding problem from the shower! To their credit, the hotel repaired the shower problem after our first complaint, but the musty odor remained. The front desk staff were quite helpful, although one fellow was rather sullen, so we would wait to ask our questions until someone else came on duty! If you stay, try to get a room that doesn't face the noisy street. Ours did, and the noise and commotion went all night long. Hotel photos show some sort of rooftop garden, but when we were there breakfast was served in a windowless room on the main floor, so I am not sure what the story was there. This was the most expensive hotel of our 2 week trip to Italy and the one we liked the least.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: KazzyDLancs
Reviews.Content: We reviewed this hotel through trip advisor and found many varying results. Its not the cheapest place to stay but what a fabulous location. The rooms were clean and spacious, bedding and towels were changed frequently during our 4 night stay as well as the complimentary toiletries. The breakfast was as expected, continental, with cheese, meat, eggs, cereal, bread, tea and great coffee. The staff were courtious and helpful nothing was too much trouble. The roof terrace was a bit of a let down,only because the furniture was old and needed a good clean, but the surrounding views were magnificent during the day or night. Step out of the front door turn left and over the bridge is the Vatican City (about a 15 minute walk away). Turn right and your into one of the most beautiful Piazza's in Rome. Rome is a walkers city so be prepared to walk. Take advantage of the hop-on hop-off bus tours to save time. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Genio Hotel, Rome in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Member8
Reviews.Content: Stopped at the Genio Hotel in Rome during a 3 city trip to Italy in July 2007. The hotel is in a great location, central for all sights. Vatican is minutes away, as is Piazza Navona. We walked to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and the Coleseum easily from here. The roof terrace is the best bit, take drink up there after dark and see all of Rome lit up before you. Room was lovely and the air conditioning a must after the hot summer days. The only let down we could find was the breakfast is very basic for 4 star hotel and could be a lot better. However would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “beware!!! beware!!!! beware!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gladiator1634
Reviews.Content: This hotel overbooks and then sends you to one of their lower rated and less desirable locations. During the first week of April we booked a room for hotel Genio for July 14, 15, 16 &17 with this hotels website Leonardihotels.com which claims you will receive the best rates available. I received what I thought was a reliable e-mail confirmation from Leonardi hotels for those dates with an excellent rate. When we arrived for our stay on July 14 we were informed that the hotel was overbooked and we would be staying at another Leonardi hotel named La Sistina which is located in the vicinity of the Spanish steps. I planned this trip many months in advance and chose this hotel mainly for its location which is very close to Piazza Navona. I had no intention or desire to stay in another part of the city. Since I had booked the room three months in advance it was difficult to understand why my room was not available. As I protested this to the hotel desk clerk he stated my booking agent must have mistakenly booked a room in a hotel that had no availability. When I produced a copy of my confirmation and explained that I had booked through the hotels very own website his response was that the manager had overbooked and there was nothing he could do for me. I requested to speak with the manager but was told he was not available. After repeatedly denying my request to speak with management the clerk agreed that I had a legitimate complaint but nothing could be done. His only assistance was to offer a taxi to the other hotel. At this point I was becoming increasingly frustrated and angry with the situation. Not only did we get scammed but the hotels response was terrible. The manager was afraid to face us and left his dirty work to the young desk clerk. Their main concern was just getting us out of the lobby as quickly as possible so we wouldn’t alarm any other guest of the hotel. Since we had nowhere else to go we had no choice but accept the offer for the hotel La Sistina. To make matters worse the La Sistina was dirty had no hot water when we tried to shower in the afternoon and was in a terrible location. I immediately started calling around for another place to stay and was lucky enough to get a room at the Portoghesi hotel which is located just around the corner from the hotel Genio. Hotel Genio’s policy of overbooking and then down grading your accommodations along with their arrogant and harsh treatment is bad business and definitely not a common practice in Italy. I traveled throughout the country over the last two years on two separate vacations and never encountered this problem. This stressful and annoying matter occurring during my vacation was really unfortunate. I definitely do not recommend hotel Genio or any other Leonardi hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Made Rome Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Calilife
Reviews.Content: Rome was the first stop on our 3 week honeymoon in Italy. We found Hotel Genio in our travel guide after having a bad experience at a B&B we had booked online. We walked in & they had availability at a great price. If you're looking for lush & extravagant this isn't the place but if you want a decent sized room for European standards, nice bathrooms, decent breakfast (with a very friendly waitress) all in a great location than this hotel is for you! The breakfast is an assortment of deli meats, pastries, cereal, fruit, juice, coffee & tea. We loved being able to go to the rooftop w/ glass of wine and take in the view. We also thought the location was perfect and walked to most places from the hotel. FYI there is a great little authentic (hard to find in the touristy areas) family owned restaurant around the corner ,Pietros, be sure to ask the hotel staff for directions. We will definately return to Hotel Genio on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: swananni
Reviews.Content: Hotel Genio had a really great location, and the hotel itself was just fine. Rooms were cleanly and good size. What about i didn't like it was the breakfast, wasn't so good enough. Roof was great, especially at nights.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Genio was Noisy but good in other ways”
Reviews.Author: drslamb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very near Piazza Navona. Very well located. The rooms are nicely decorated and the bathroom was exceptional. Really new and clean. It's on a busy street and so you hear traffic almost all night long in spite of the shutters that shut out light and some sound. The breakfast in the morning is very full but the staff seem overwhelmed at times to get everyone their coffee. There is internet access for a fee in the lobby. I might use this hotel again because of the way it looked and its location but I also might look around for a quieter place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, lovely service, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Lateral
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Genio with friends from 4th to 7th of January in two great double rooms. The location was gorgeous, 10 min. away from the Vatican and just behind Piazza Navona. The service was perfect, very gentle and worm people. Nice breacfast, superb cappuccino. The rooms were very clean with well equiped bathrooms. My friends even got the room 207 with the one and only lovely terrace. If you visit this hotel check the big roof terrace with its great view. Great hotel, unforgettable city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mrs-holidaymaker
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Genio for its position in spite of some rather negative reviews - and we were not disappointed - 2 mins from Piazza Navona - could not have been better placed! Also there is a panoramic roof terrace from where you can pick out the Vittorio Emmanuel monument, the Pantheon and Trinita dei Monte - a wonderful place to take your drinks and "drink" in the views! Close by - in the little side streets - there are also numerous restaurants to choose from for your evening meal, a slightly cheaper option than P. Navona itself , although the atmosphere in the piazza makes for a wonderful evening. However the hotel itself does have some downsides - although we were lucky enough to get a room on the top floor with its own private roof terrace, the room itself was not really up to 4* standard- there was no bedside table or lamp at one side of the double bed, the carpet had seen better days, and there were no English language channels on the T.V. The breakfast room was small and cramped and the food was adequate but uninteresting. If location is a major consideration for your choice of hotel - as it it for us - then definitely choose the Genio, but if the decor and comfort of your accommodation matters more to you then I recommend you go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Roof-terrasse with breathtaking view”
Reviews.Author: krogh
Reviews.Content: Single rooms have no view, but from the rooftop-terrasse you can see all Rome. Nice and helpful staff. Breakfast - well - not the worst I have had in Rome. Location is perfect just 1 minute by foot from Navona.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel !”
Reviews.Author: irefuseonprinciple
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, this hotel is in an amazing location next to the Piazza Navona. Take the time to go to the roof garden of the building for amazing views over Rome (Vatican/ Pantheon, Emmanuale Victoire great big building!). Hotel staff happy to let you take breakfast up to roof garden and also take in bottles of wine etc to sit up there of an evening and enjoy the sunsets. We had no problems with booking (through EasyJet), hotel were expecting us when we arrived. Room was fine, clean, nice bathroom, staff very helpful and friendly giving information on sites etc. Excellent location - lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PECKY
Reviews.Content: We had a triple room on the second floor of this hotel. The room was lovely and clean and quite spacious i thought for a triple. The bathrom was ok too. We overlooked the busy road below but was not bothered by the noise as we had double glazing. (If you visit a city you've got to expect noise?) The only thing I would gripe about was the breakfast and the breakfast room itself. The room is too small for the amount of guests and is cramped. The breakfast was nasty. Luke warm water for tea I expect just taken from the kitchen sink tap! Not much choice of cereals etc: Would have been nice to have at least a toaster. The location is absolutely perfect, it is so close to everything. Didn't realise on the first day it was just a stones throw away from piazza novona and if you cut through the piazza you can walk straight to the phantheon, trevi and spanish steps. As other people have mentioned we were worried about the hotel overbooking etc but we confirmed our booking twice before we left and was ok. We had a really lovely time in Rome and im hoping to visit with my husband in October this year. I would stay here again but not eat breakfast yuk! No other complaints what so ever lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location not the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trace27_84
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I stayed here from the 17th-23rd July for part of our honeymoon. I booked this hotel purely for location and went there expecting problems after reading some of the reviews. Firstly I read that a lot of people had problems with their bookings so I took it upon myself to reconfirm our stay on the 7th July for when we arrive on the 16th. The hotel re-confirmed and said I booking was reconfirmed. When we arrived the hotel informed us that there was a problem with our booking so we had to be taken to Hotel Elisio near the Spanish Steps. This really upset me. We only had to stay there one night mind. We then got a free taxi to Hotel Genio on the 17th and then that's where all the other problems began... We had a powercut for 3 days, no TV, not lights, no AC. Because there are no windows in the hall ways you couldn't see a thing. I had to be guided up the stairs by my husband flicking a lighter. No candles were offered but eventually put at the top of the stairs. Of course during our time Rome was experiencing a heat wave so having no AC was unbearable. We tried to stay away from the hotel as much as possible and managed to enjoy our stay never the less purely for the hotel's remarkable location, walking distance to just about all sights. Please don't let my reveiw put you off staying at this hotel because we were obviously just extremely unlucky but I really do advise if you do book your stay please be advised that your booking may not be secure. Phabio behind the front desk kindly gave us 20% off our rate which was a nice gesture considering that it wasn't their fault entirely for our unhappy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Tourcrafters for 3 nights and was disappointed in the service but loved the location. ADVANTAGES The hotel is just steps away from Piazza Navona and just a couple of blocks from the Vatican! The Colloseum & Trevi Fountain are further away, but if you don't mind walking a bit, it's still within a reasonable walking distance. It was extremely close to lots of restaurants. The hotel is clean and presentable, rooms are reasonably sized and comfy, baths are clean. Our first room was incredibly warm but when the ac finally got started, the room cooled down nicely. When we left the room, either the housekeeping staff would turn off the ac or it would turn off automatically because everytime we came back it was hot again. They served a cold buffet breakfast. I would have expected some hot items but at least they had some variety, like fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals. Roof patio was very pretty with pretty views. Most of the hotel service was nice but some were not too helpful. Now for the DISADVANTAGES: Hotel was noisy!! I kept hearing banging and lots of clattering very early in the morning. One day, a loud alarm kept going off. At first it sounded like the hotel fire alarm or an alarm coming from the street. I was about to get up to investigate when it finally stopped. Our room ran out of hot water! It was 11PM when we realized that there was no hot water and that only one set of towels were given. I went to the lobby to report it. The guy behind the desk informed me that there wasn't anything he could do since it was so late at night and housekeeping had already left. He said all other rooms were filled except for one which had no working ac. Our only option was to keep our same room but go shower in the vacant room with no ac. Not convenient since our room was on the 1st floor and the vacant one was on the 5th floor. Fortunately, the 5th floor had hot water, even though you really didn't need it since the whole room was so hot with no AC and luckily they had left spare towels in there. Unfortunately the shower door was broken so we had to deal with that ourselves. Atleast this happened on our last night there. I can not honestly say that staying at this hotel made our trip unenjoyable but it could have made it more comfortable for us. My suggestion to potential hotel guests is to find a different hotel with better service!!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Thought Required To Realise Hotel Genio's Full Potential”
Reviews.Author: eileen_2
Reviews.Content: Booked through Easyjet to stay at Hotel Genio for four nights at the end of June. Three people travelling, booked a single and a twin room. Twin room £50 per person per night, for bed and breakfast, an absolute bargain for this location in Rome, at this time. I emailed Leonardi Hotels direct prior to our stay to confirm the reservations. Thankfully, on arrival there were no horror stories to report re overbooking, as has happened previously to far too many unfortunate guests. There were no details from previous Trip Advisor reviews if this had happened with direct bookings only, perhaps this is the case as I’m sure booking agents such as Easyjet/HotelBeds would not want the flack if this was usual practise with booking made through them. The rooms were located on the same floor, near each other and facing the quieter side street. Noise was not a problem as the windows were sound proofed, closed all during our stay and the air conditioning left on constantly. The air conditioning was more than adequate in the single room but on a couple of occasions the same sized a/c unit in the twin room didn’t keep us as cool as we would have liked. A fan was borrowed from reception for the duration of our stay and made the room more comfortable when needed. The rooms and bathrooms were immaculate, bedding and towels changed daily. All rooms had satellite TV, complimentary toiletries and a reasonably priced minibar. Safety deposit boxes were available in reception at €3 per day. Rooms were large on floor space and storage. Bathrooms were finished in marble, larger than expected and had powerful showers. The roof terrace was quiet, covered in lovely flowering pots, with plenty of tables and chairs and caught the sun all day. A great place to sit and relax after a busy day sightseeing with a magnificent view of St Peter’s Basilica. The plastic chairs were of poor quality, more befitting a street side cafe than a four star hotel. Umbrellas would have been nice, to avoid the baking sun and perhaps a reason guests decided not to frequent during the day. We were lucky enough to have the exclusive use of the roof terrace throughout most of our stay. The downstairs bar closed at 9.30 pm which was disappointing and perhaps more guests would have used the terrace if this had not been the case and the terrace lighting had been on. The cold buffet breakfast was disappointing for a four star hotel. Plenty of juice, fresh fruit, yoghurts, cereals, hard boiled eggs, ham, cheese and cakes. The waitress had to be asked to replace items which would result in a ten minute wait. Tea and coffee were served at your table and on one occasion were cold, as the machine wasn’t working. Rather than tell guests that it would take ten minutes to boil water, you were served cold drinks. The breakfast room is rather small and bland, what a wasted opportunity that breakfast is not available on the roof terrace, which is undoubtedly the strong point of the Genio. Of course you can take your breakfast up to the roof terrace but as the lift seemed to have a mind of its own a lengthy wait ensued. The staff at Hotel Genio were helpful, but not overly friendly, at all times. Taxis were organised for various sightseeing trips for us by the hotel and arrived within minutes. Staying so near Piazza Navona was wonderful, having such a fabulous location as our “local” for a nightcap could not be beaten. Despite having been to Rome on other occasions we had never ventured west of Piazza Navona previously but discovered lovely pedestrianised street full of restaurants and shops. These were busy but not as busy as the usual Piazza Navona – Pantheon beaten track in the opposite direction and were so cheap in comparison. On the whole a GOOD hotel, great location but a little thought re breakfast and using the terrace to its full potential wouldn't go amiss and would have resulted in a review of an EXCELLENT hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book at the Genio Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room in September 2005 for Easter 2006. We got a confirmation by fax that we had a reservation. In March 2006 the hotel Genio again confirmed to us that the reservation in the hotel was OK. When we arrived on Sunday April 10, 2006 and asked for our room, we were told that the hotel was fully booked and that they had no room for us. They offered us a room in another hotel in the Leonardi Hotels, which we had to accept because we were not sure if we could find another hotel by ourselves on a Sunday at Easter time in Rome. We have later on come to the conclusion that the Hotel Genio overbooks on purpose (many people want to stay there because of its location) and then they send the overbooked guests to the other Leonardi Hotels which have free rooms. We were very disappointed and angry. How can a serious hotel chain operate like that?

Reviews.Title: “Location only reason for staying here”
Reviews.Author: crushdummy
Reviews.Content: Location near the Vatican, Piazza Navona and an interesting neighborhood are the hotel’s best points. However, it is on a noisy street and you have to keep the windows closed if you have a front room. We had one facing the side street and it was not too noisy. Room size and bathroom were OK. The A/C could not be adjusted from the control. The furniture looks like it was purchased at a yard sale or flea market. Basically, cast off Ikea stuff. Nothing matched, handles were falling off, missing clothes hanger bar and hangers in wardrobe. Impossible to sit in upholstered chair. No info in room about TV (it received 5 channels, one of which was MTV), A/C, telephone rates, safe, etc. Shower spray broken so it is directed at your waist. Burnt-out lights in ceiling not replaced during week stay even though we reported them days earlier. The hall carpets were mismatched and probably purchased at remainder sales. Overall, the hotel had a tacky look. The staff was very helpful and gave us dinnerware from the breakfast room so we could eat dinner on the roof patio. The hotel does not mention it in the promotional material. We found it by chance. It has a beautiful view over Rome and the Vatican. You can pick up excellent prepared foods from nearby shops and eat on the patio. Otherwise, there are many good restaurant choices nearby.

Reviews.Title: “You cant beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: cazbaz1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, literally round the corner from the nicest square in Rome - Piazza Navona and a 5-10 min walk to the vatican, Trevi Fountain etc etc. We were spoilt with a room on the 5th floor that had a balcony growing lemons!! but i'd just like to clarify that we paid the cheapest rate around so it doesnt matter who you book with......they will put you where they have availability at the time!! Rooms are big and typically Italian (dont expect many hotel rooms in Italy to be modern and huge, hotels are mainly small with lots of Italian character and this adds to the experience!) i'd also like to add that the hotel and rooms were spotlessly clean....inside and out! The Reception guys were fantastic and offered information and maps without even asking for it.....nothing was ever too much trouble! Its very easy to walk the whole of the city however I would recommend everyone to purchase a ticket for the red hop on, hop off bus that travels around the city, for #13 euros for 1 day unlimited travel, it includes a map and headphones to listen to the guide that gives you some very intersting facts about the city! And last but not least, you must go on to the roof terrace to admire the view....or better still purchase some drinks from the local shop and relax after a busy day of sightseeing and watch the sun set on the vatican......priceless!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 4 nites with my partner in January. We loved the hotel. The room we had was large, the bathroom was spacious and the views were fantastic. The hotel staff were very plesent and helped us whenever they could.

Reviews.Title: “We refused to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Genio (4* hotel)only to find trash strewn about the outside of the building and left on the window ledges. Inside, the desk clerk was rude and arrogant, too busy chatting on the phone to deal with us. The lobby area was dirty as was the front sitting room. When he finally decided to speak with us, I asked for the key to one of the rooms we had reserved. The elevator had a musty, dirty smell, but I proceeded to the room, hoping that things would get better. I unlocked the door to the room and a terrible odor (dirt, dust and must) was extremly noticeable. The room was small, dank and the furniture falling apart. The carpet was stained and dirty. I never even bothered looking into the bathroom. It definitely did not look anything like the picture on this website. I left the room and refused to stay in such a place at such a price. The clerk charged me for 2 rooms for one night. I will never do business with nycerome again. This hotel is lucky to be classified a 2* at best. Journey toward the piazza and check into the Rafael Hotel instead!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at Genio”
Reviews.Author: Panis
Reviews.Content: We returned yesterday from a 5 day stay at the Genio. I felt compelled to put a review on trip advisor as there were so many terrible reviews I almost cancelled our booking, however we arrived to find a perfectly good hotel with very helpful and friendly staff. The hotel is in a fantastic location and you can walk every where from here. It is surrounded with restaurants and bars. Our room was on the 5th floor with a balcony,we had a comfortable,clean bed, mini bar and tv. The bathroom was great,immaculately clean and all marble with a huge mirror, it was great to soak in the lovely bath at the end of a days sight seeing, lovely thick white bath towels too. As said on other reviews the view from the roof terrace is breathtaking. The hotel staff could not be more helpful explaining and advising on any thing you needed help with and they also arranged a car for the airport (45 euros for Ciampino). We will definitely be staying at the Genio on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Genio is 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Moved to this hotel from a dump!! We were given two great rooms on the fifth floor, one for our three children and one for my husband and I. Both rooms had great balconies and soundproof windows and shutters. Our room was not huge but fine. (How much time do you spend in your room anyway?) The bathroom and our room were very clean and the bed was firm. Our children had a large room that accomodated the three of them very easily. The staff was helpful and the breakfast was fresh and plentiful. There are many good small restaurants within walking distance of one or two blocks and you are less than one block from the Piazza Navona. This hotel has a great location. Although we had no problems, from other reviews it sounds like you should be careful who you make your reservations through. I was told that booking through some of the big travel sites would get you a cheap rate but definitely not one of the better rooms. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Worst Hotels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: How can I say...DON'T STAY THERE. First, the service is terrible... oh wait... if there was any service that is... however, there is no assistance with your bags, I had to ask for a map of the area and there is not enough help (the bus boy doubles as the bartender, custodian, and any other duties that may arise) As for the front desk person, he's rude and has no decernible people skills. Oh yes... the room.. It's small, (normal for most european hotels) but the bed is a disgrace -- a pop up cot and 4 inch mattress is a joke - not to mention lumpy and generally uncomfortable. This is NOT a bed. And as a bonus -- ants in the bathroom. SWELL.. Stay away from this hotel. THIS CAN'T be a FOUR STAR. Book this hotel at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RWPJW216
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Genio Hotel for four nights in early November and everything was fine. I contacted the hotel well in advance to request a good room & an airport transfer. The airport transfer went smoothly – the taxi driver was still waiting for us even though our flight was 45 minutes late. The room was a good size, with a view of the street, and even had a hydro bath, which was great to relax in after a tiring day. The staff I dealt with were all polite and helpful. The location is superb and I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Genio”
Reviews.Author: nanisivik
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are seasoned travelers. We have stayed at some of the best hotels. This year, we were celebrating our 25th anniversary. We stayed at the Hotel Genio in Rome for 6 nights in September. We found the hotel to be more than adequate. The location is wonderful, right in the heart of the city at Piazza Navona, with great restaurants and within walking distance of every major site. We found the staff to be friendly and accommodating. Our room, # 608, was comparable to North American standards, very clean, though it needed some refurbishing. It had a queen sized bed and plenty of room to move around as well as good closet space. Our bathroom was a nice size with modern amenities, including a real hair dryer (however no bathtub to relax in after a full day of walking!). There is also a nice rooftop terrace on the sixth floor with breathtaking views of Rome and St. Peter's. The breakfast was good -- fruits, croissants, muffins, breads, cereals, meats, cheeses, and hardboiled eggs and great coffee. We were quite happy with this hotel and would definitely stay there again and would not hesitate to recommend the Genio to friends! This hotel was booked through the Venere Hotel reservation site. This was our third hotel booked with Venere on this trip and we had no complications whatsoever and all the hotels were exactly what we expected. We also recommend the Venere website for hotel bookings. Robin & Fran Montreal, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for getting around Rome, but the size of the room was very small for American taste. Room 202 was tiny, with two single beds joined together to form a very unconfortable sleeping experience. The windows looked out on to an ugly service courtyard and the room was a tomb. The room and bathroom stank of dirty drains. An unpleasant experience I would not put my pet through! Oh, did I mention the problem about making reservations (confirmed with voucher) back in June and when my wife and I arrived for the first part of stay (Sept 24, 25), I was told my reservation was concelled back in June. I contacted the booking company and i was told that the reservation was valid and not cancelled. My wife and I just traveled over 12 hours and were very tired so took the move to a different hotel (which was a nice one but near the Train Station very far away from the Central part of Rome...I picked this hotel for location not price)...When my wife and I returned to Rome (after a cruise) we did have a room but it was terrible as described above...I would never stay at Genio Hotel, as the room, at least the one we had) was terrible and I belive they bait and switch people who are STUCK in a foreign city. I think I may complain to the Embassy here in Washington about my experience so others will not be put through what we were. I love Rome and I will return but will not consider Genio as a place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Genio - a con!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Back at the beginning of May 2005, I booked a package trip to Rome to include two double rooms at the Hotel Genio in Room for my husband and I and our friends. Two days before we were due to arrive, I called the central reservations desk for Leonardi Hotels to check the reservations and obtain a reservation number direct from the company as well as the e-mail confirmations I had through the holiday company. I also called the hotel direct and booked a car to meet us at the airport. We were duly met by a driver whose mobile phone rang once we were in the car. The call was from the receptionist at Hotel Genio who advised me that there had been a problem with the bookings, the hotel was overbooked and we did not have rooms there but at a sister hotel, Hotel Eliseo. Hotel Genio is very central in Rome which is why we choose the hotel - Hotel Eliseo is not central! It is a good 25 minutes walk north of the Hotel Genio. After a heated discussion, it was pretty obvious that we had no choice but to take second best and check into Hotel Eliseo. We walked to Hotel Genio on the same day and found a foyer full of people who had all made reservations to stay there and were being advised which hotel in the Leonardi Hotels group they had been reassigned to for their stay. The Leonardi Hotels group obviously uses Hotel Genio as the lure due to the location, takes overbookings and then transfers guests to the sister hotels - all of which are some distance from the centre of Rome. Beware - it would appear this is how the group operates all the time. If you book Hotel Genio, chances are you will end up in a different hotel.
