Reviews.Title: “Great Location but be ready to fight for your reservation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Piazza Navona is the perfect location for a stay in Rome....this hotel may not be. We arrived to check in at 3pm and were told there was a mistake and they did not get our reservations early enough (we booked a month ago) and they had booked us at another of there hotels. Because I had read in TripAdvisor about this happening to others at this hotel, I immediately put a halt to it. I told them that since it was early in the day, and I was sure that not everyone had checked in yet, they could move someone else who came later if it was still necessary. The desk clerk backed down immediately, but put us in a closet of a room. I immediately went back down stairs, voiced my displeasure and was put in a room twice the size with a great view. My advice: If you stick to your guns and can get them to honor your reservation, stay there....If you want no confrontation, and simply expect to get what you book, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Box room”
Reviews.Author: donaeb83
Reviews.Content: Arrived late in Rome on 24th August and we were collected from Chaimpino Airport through the hotel at a set price of 50 euros + plus a 5 euros late night supplement. The hotel is in an excellent location 2 mins from Navona Square and within walkable distance to most locations. Our first room was tiny, on the first floor with no natural daylight, the shutters could not be opened as staff would see inside. The air-con unit blasted us in the face from the side when we slept but it was too warm to shut it off. Finally there was no hot water in the morning, although the bathroom was larger and modern compared to the room. Thankfully we were moved to a room that was double the size and even had a balcony, but we couldn't use it due to 2 air-con unit outputs blasting out hot air! Otherwise the staff were friendly the breakfast was suitable and the open roof top made the trip special. If I went back it would be for the location and i'd try to get room 609 (i think) as the balcony was huge.

Reviews.Title: “Super place to stay in Rome. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews before we went. Hotel was very clean. Some rooms are small by 4 Star standards but if you are not happy then you will be changed to a larger room as soon as one is available. Through no fault of the Hotel's, we moved room on two occassions and were happy with all the rooms. Breakfast was excellent and the staff were exceptionally helpful. Will be going back to this Hotel. The location more than compensates for the smaller rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recommend this hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: go_china
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed 2 nights at this hotel (post-cruise). Pre-cruise was at the Hotel Anglo Americano which I do not recommend. I recommend this hotel because of its EXCELLENT LOCATION (just around the corner from Piazza Navona - less than 2 min walk; the Pantheon, the Vatican is less than 15 min walk). We walked to everywhere from this hotel. The rooms are clean and decent (we had 2 rooms - 1 w/ a double bed and 1 w/ 2 twin beds). The AC did its job but it could be a little better. The bathroom is all marble and also decent. The hairdryer is actually from this century! Breakfast is nicely presented and the coffee is served to you at your table. The dining room is small but clean and attractive. The staff understands English and is courteous! Other reviewers are correct about the patio on the 6th floor. It's a nice bonus. This is certainly not the Ritz but overall we had a very pleasant experience staying at the Genio and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: John-the-rocket
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay at the Genio. Clean and comfortable and all the staff friendly and helpful. The location is wonderful, just steps away from Piazza Navona, 10 minutes to Vatican City and short walk to other sites around. Breakfast more than adequate. Take a drink and go up to the rooftop terrace for a view of sunset over St Peters and the rooftops of Rome. Use their car service, lot cheaper than taxi's to and from the airport. We recommend this hotel and will use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Very Nice Stay & would come agan”
Reviews.Author: NJZeke
Reviews.Content: Like so many other reviewers indicate - you can't beat this location. Almost everything is within walking distance. If you like ROME, you'll like this hotel. The rooms are very nice as well, although not too big (typical of Italy). Staff is very friendly. I actually stayed here 2 times (both end of an italian vacation). Both rooms were very nice. My only 'drawback' at all is that my 'second' room overlooked an air passage/alley at the base of which was a restaurant kitchen. I'm a sound sleeper and I actually enjoyed hearing 'mambo italiano' playing on the radio, but I can see how other travelers wouldn't be charmed by this as I was. I'll also mention (although it's NOT the hotel's fault) that I made the mistake of driving into Rome. Having a car in Rome was a headache. The hotel had access to a garage so it worked out, but it cost $$$ and I didn't use it in the city - so next time, I'll rent a car as I leave Rome, and save the headache and cost. Anyway - I'd definately stay here again - I loved it. Loved the location and loved the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Deepdale
Reviews.Content: I was at the Genio from 30 April - 2 May 2005. We stayed in a triple on the 5th floor. We found our room to be clean and of good size with lovely bathroom. We found the staff to be nice and efficient. The breakfast was very good - cereal, meat, cheese, hard-boiled eggs, fruit, yoghurt, fresh bread, juice and tea/coffee. A real plus is that the hotel is centrally located around the corner from Piazza Navona which was great for the evening as there was so many restaurants and bars and good atmosphere. 10 mins walk to the Vatican and Trevi Fountain. When we came back to our hotel in early evening after sightseeing we would take a bottle of wine up to the Hotel's roof top terrace which has glorious views. I would happily stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rome is all about location. This hotel is central to the Vatican City, Panthenon and Piazza Novana. The staff were courteous and and friendly, the buffet was abundant and the rooms were clean. Its more of a high end 3 star hotel, but when you're walking around Rome all day, who cares how big the room is, so long as its comfortable and close to home!

HotelInfo.Name: Genio Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via G Zanardelli 28, 00186 Rome, Italy
